definition: some cases picked out as example/to highlight
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Here are few examples to illustrate this principle .
sentences.chinese: 略举数例，用以说明这一原理。

sentences.english: This can only be due to the occasional touch, cite a few side can not but be regrettable omissions.
sentences.chinese: 本文只能因偶尔触及，略举数端，不免要挂一漏万的。

definition: to provide as expedient/to use temporarily as/to make shift
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
to just talk for the sake of talking
